alert.note: Alert for Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:52PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Scotts Bluff, southwestern Sioux and east central Goshen Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 552 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Yoder to near Lyman. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Morrill, Lyman, Huntley and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
